## Title: 2022 World Data Analysis

---

## Introduction
- Analysis of 2022 World Data
- Focus on the relationship between GDP and Life Expectancy AND population by countries.

---

## Research Question

How does GDP relate to life expectancy?
How is world population distributed?

---

## Variables of interest
- gdp_per_capita
- life_expectancy
- total_population

---

## Visualization
```{python}
import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv('wdi.csv')
#| label: fig-scatter-gdp-life
#| fig-cap: "Relationship between GDP per Capita and Life Expectancy"
#| echo: false
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
plt.scatter(df['gdp_per_capita'], df['life_expectancy'], alpha=0.5)
plt.title('GDP vs Life Expectancy (2022)')
plt.xlabel('GDP per Capita (USD)')
plt.ylabel('Life Expectancy (Years)')
plt.show()

#| label: fig-bars
#| fig-cap: "Top 10 Countries by Total Population (2022)."
#| echo: false

import seaborn as sns

top_10_pop = df.nlargest(10, 'total_population')

plt.figure(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.barplot(data=top_10_pop, x='total_population', y='country')
plt.title('Top 10 Countries by Population')
plt.xlabel('Total Population')
plt.ylabel('Country')
plt.show()
```

---

## Conclusion
- Countries with higher GDP per capita 
generally report higher life expectancy. 
- The distribution of global population is highly concentrated.
